intro: Racosperma holotrichum, commonly known as the hairy racosperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage and small, pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small white or pale yellow flowers, which are clustered in racemes, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
